alert.note: Alert for Adams; Franklin (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 07 at 10:35AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Adams and Franklin. * WHEN...Until 1245 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1034 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain has fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chambersburg, Waynesboro, Greencastle, Guilford, St. Thomas, Carroll Valley, Fayetteville, Wayne Heights, Mont Alto, Mercersburg, Scotland, Rouzerville, Marion, Fort Loudon, Cashtown, Orrtanna, Claylick, State Line, Fairfield and McKnightstown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
